info.label: Test Automation Engineer at BJSS
info.brief: Quality focused developer with a passion for building well designed, well tested products and crafting amazing experiences.

employment.summary: 9 years development experience, 5 year experience working on open source, 8 years experience working in healthcare. 6 months working in Test Automation

history.summary: Working within a team of four to continue the work I did at my previous job but in an enterprise setting. Working with Python and JavaScript to help shape the way that hospitals run wards and care for patients, while ensuring the product met the needs of the user by using validated learning techniques, TDD and BDD.
highlights: Worked with global betting brand to bring their current online offering to the USA
Built JavaScript automation framework to test highly distributed Kafka based application
Assisted team in containerising legacy applications and deploying them to AWS and Kubernetes
Worked with NHS mental health trusts to design and develop a version of Open-eObs that met their specific needs
Built automated test suite and integrated it into team’s continuous delivery pipeline

history.summary: Leading a team of eight amazing people to create high quality software with a focus on delivering value to our users via Lean and Agile methods. Co-ordinated the adoption of Scrum and Continuous delivery practices as well helped to build a culture of validated learning and knowledge sharing within the company. Conducted staff performance reviews, appraisals and one-to-ones as well as other managerial duties.
highlights: Lead a team of eight developers, testers and UX practioners
Worked with managing directors to deliver and increase quality of product
Created mobile frontend for Open-eObs, a mobile application used by frontline NHS staff to submit patient observations using Odoo - a Python powered ERP system

history.summary: I worked as a Web Developer and Designer in the Communications Unit at St George's Healthcare NHS Trust. As well as maintaining the Trust's website and developing new features for the website I also managed the Trust's Social Media accounts. My work with St George's Healthcare's Social Media accounts has been mentioned in the Financial Times and the Guardian Healthcare Network blog. I also lead a project that saw St George's Hospital become the first UK hospital to offer interior maps on Google Maps as well as redesigned and redeveloped the St George's Healthcare website.
highlights: Worked with Google to map the indoors of St George's Hospital - the largest Hospital in London
Created unique mobile friendly websites for the trust's mandatory publications, saving £6,000 per publication

history.summary: Achieved a First using Augmented Reality in an artistic context

sets.name: Software Development
skills: Five years Python experience (Odoo, Django, Flask, Python 2 & 3, Nose, PyTest)
7 years JavaScript experience (jQuery, React & Redux, PouchDB, Backbone.js, CoffeeScript, Karma, Jasmine, Jest, Gulp, Enzyme, Webpack)
iOS & Android app development using React Native
Continuous Delivery with Github, Travis & Heroku/AWS

sets.name: Quality Assurance
skills: Writing Gherkin features to describe the behaviour of the product
Automated browser testing of Gherkin with Python, Selenium and Sauce Labs
Using SonarQube to inspect quality of the code base and drive quality improvements
Using Zephyr and Jira to create bi-directional traceability between tests and work items
Artifact based Continuous Delivery with Docker, GOCD and Amazon Web Services

sets.name: Product Development
skills: Product Discovery using validated learning techniques and UX principles to better understand the domain and user groups
User Story mapping to build Portfolio and Product Backlogs
Working with stake-holders to cut User Story Map into release slices
Backlog grooming and sprint planning to ensure work items meet definition of ready with Product Owner and QA
Leading a development team using either Scrum or Kanban to deliver product increments and value to the user
User engagement to get feedback on released functionality and update backlog
